summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous relevant resolutions, condemns the 14 February 2005 terrorist bombing and other attacks in Lebanon since October 2004, and reaffirms that those involved must be held accountable.

The Council examined the report of the International Independent Investigation Commission (S/2008/210) and commends the Commission for its professional work in assisting Lebanese authorities in investigating the terrorist act.

The Council extends the mandate of the Commission until 31 December 2008, and declares its readiness to terminate the mandate earlier if the Commission reports completion of its mandate.

The Council requests the Commission to report on the progress of the investigation at the latest in six months and decides to remain seized of the matter.
